author: gstein
msg: Fix up some pristine handling and log running/management.
In r926814, I compensated for a case where an added file *had* a pristine
and the code was expecting that. Thus, I disabled the special check for
added files. This was incorrect: added files should NOT have pristines,
and the code (svn_wc_add_repos_file4) which expected it... was wrong. This
revision fixes that assumption, and restores the correct behavior to
svn_wc__get_pristine_contents()
This also eliminates svn_wc__run_log2() in favor of manual write checks
and directly calling the wq_run() function. By directly using wq_run(), we
also get to pass a cancel func/baton.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c:
(cleanup_dir_baton): directly call wq_run and don't bother with a write
check. when a dir was opened, that was performed.
(do_entry_deletion, close_directory): directly call wq_run.
(open_directory): perform a write check for this directory
(svn_wc_add_repos_file4): svn_wc__open_writable_base returns an abspath,
so note that with the localvar and remove a get_absolute later. only
install a text base for copied fles. directly call wq_run. if the file
is added, then construct the working file from the temp "pristine"
rather than from the true pristine source. finally, only use
OP_FILE_INSTALL for copied files (which have pristines).
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c:
(svn_wc__get_pristine_contents): restore the check for "added" nodes,
which have no pristine.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.h:
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.c:
(svn_wc__run_log2): removed
* subversion/libsvn_wc/merge.c:
(svn_wc_merge4): move the computation of DIR_ABSPATH to a tighter scope.
perform a write check, and then call wq_run with the cancel func/baton.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/props.c:
(svn_wc_merge_props3): move the declaration of KIND to a tighter scope
and simplify the computation of DIR_ABSPATH. perform a write check,
and then install the props and stuff, then call wq_run with the cancel
func/baton. combined two if-blocks for clarity.
